text: curious what your take is on the idea of
somebody
putting some rocket fuel on their css or
maybe kind of like skipping over
to a certain degree with a framework and
saying well i'm going to pick up the
framework
and it's going to allow me to make some
websites even if i don't totally
understand
exactly the way it's working like a
tailwind or bootstrap
whatever bulma whatever your flavor
happens to be
and actually start a little bit with the
framework and learn css through
framework usage do you think that's wise
or do you think that's foolhardy
i would not recommend that i mean when
you look at for example bootstrap or
tailwind or something you easily get
motivated i mean you look at the
beautiful pages and then you get
motivated to learn that stuff
but i think it's going to be later on
benefiting for you if you know the css
property
so i think you don't need to learn
really that if you look at the like the
purple boxes if you learn the basics run
the layout so these are the
items that i think you should learn
beforehand before you
jump on to the frameworks and you don't
really need to learn about all the like
animation and css3 stuff and like all of
this
deep deep stuff but just get the basic
idea get like
learn how to create like the basic pages
and then move on to maybe the frameworks
if you look at the css frameworks i have
put it like
fifth sixth place maybe it's
quite below that
